Description: ServiceRequest.Search (Dental Procedure) allows a client to search for dental procedure details by patient, category, and status. Dental procedures are individual actions (fillings, extractions, crowns, root canals, and so on) performed on a patient. They exist as part of a normal visit or an ad hoc visit.

category.Name: category
category.Description: Points a search to the correct subresource. Specify “dental-procedure” for ServiceRequest. Data will be returned if this parameter is left blank, or if one of its values is the dental category.

onlyscannable.Name: onlyscannable
onlyscannable.Description: If “true”,  only scannable orders and procedures are returned in the response. This feature requires a user to have login department context as part of the API request, otherwise error code 59100 is returned.

patient.Name: patient
patient.Description: The patient to search for data for.

status.Name: status
status.Description:
The procedure statuses to search for. This parameter is ignored if the “_id” parameter is included in the search. The accepted values are active, draft, completed, and revoked, which respectively correspond to the Planned, Planning, Completed, and Discontinued statuses of procedures. 

If the status property is not set, procedures of every status (including Draft and Discontinued) will be returned. If set, only the specified status will be returned.

Bundle.Name: Bundle
Bundle.Description: Resource bundle. For more information, refer to the FHIR specification.

ServiceRequest.Name: ServiceRequest
ServiceRequest.Description: An instance of the R4 ServiceRequest resource.

authoredOn.Name: authoredOn
authoredOn.Description: The date of creation of the associated order.

bodySite.Name: bodySite
bodySite.Description: The tooth, surface, and area of the mouth.

code.Name: code
code.Description: The procedure display name, code (D-code or other code), and code system.

intent.Name: intent
intent.Description: Returns "order" for planned or completed procedures and "plan" otherwise.

is-scannable-encounter.Name: extension
is-scannable-encounter.Description: If true, this order or procedure is scannable.

performer.Name: performer
performer.Description: Reference to the Practitioner that who placed the request.

reasonReference.Name: reasonReference
reasonReference.Description: External codings for diagnosis records associated with this order.

status.Name: status
status.Description:
The status of the request. Supported values include:

  • draft
  • active
  • completed
  • revoked

supportingInfo.Name: supportingInfo
supportingInfo.Description: Procedure reference to the associated dental order. Populated only if the Condition resource will show data.
